metadata.title: CVE-2020-15049 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in http/ContentLengthInterpreter.cc in Squid before4.12 and 5.x before 5.0.3. A Request Smuggling and Poisoning attack cansucceed against the HTTP cache. The client sends an HTTP request with aContent-Length header containing "+\ "-" or an uncommon shell whitespacecharacter prefix to the length field-value.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15049` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 4.10-1ubuntu1.3
squid-cgi - 4.10-1ubuntu1.3
squid-common - 4.10-1ubuntu1.3
squid-purge - 4.10-1ubuntu1.3
squidclient - 4.10-1ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.10-1ubuntu1.3').
